title: Need help finding right variable for ebay API
author: t2_64wh7
text:
I put together a script (below) to take search terms from input.txt, find how many eBay listings are available for that term, then print it to output.txt. This uses the variable '**totalentries**'.  
  
Now I would like to make a similar script that searches the list of terms, and returns the number of items sold/ completed in the last 90 days ([example](https://imgur.com/a/uDiqPlG) of what I'm looking for).  However I can't find the right variable to use in place of "totalentries". Terms like "TotalSold", "QuantitySold", "totalSoldQuantity", "SoldQuantity", "CompletedItems", "findCompletedItems" will give a "**AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'text'**" error.
  
I found the original "totalentries" term from a tutorial, and now I have no idea how to hunt down the appropriate variable off the [ebay API developer site](https://developer.ebay.com). Can anyone guide me on how to find the magic word?
    

> from ebaysdk.finding import Connection as Finding  
> from bs4 import BeautifulSoup  
> import sys  
> import time  
>     
  
> ID_APP = '*****'  
> 
> sys.stdout = open('output.txt', "w")    
> 
> with open("input.txt") as fl:  
>     file_contents = [x.rstrip() for x in fl]  
> 
> 
> for query in file_contents:  
>     Keywords = query  
>     api = Finding(appid=ID_APP, config_file=None)  
>     api_request = { 'keywords': Keywords }  
>     response = api.execute('findItemsByKeywords', api_request)  
>     
soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content,'lxml')  
>   
>     
**totalentries = int(soup.find('totalentries').text)**  
>   
>     
print(query, ';', totalentries)    
>     time.sleep(1)
